ground_truth: He takes a bite of his sandwich and a sip of coffee. Lee sets her glass on the kitchen counter and walks towards the bedroom area. She starts to take off her wet clothes by the bed. Frederick takes off his glasses. He turns and looks at Lee in surprise. He pulls Lee down next to him on the bed. She sighs. Lee runs into the kitchen, her hands tight around her chest. Lee, fraught with emotion, briefly puts her outstretched hands on the refrigerator door, then turns around and leans against it, hugging herself, her blouse still unbuttoned, her hair still wet and bedraggled. Frederick enters the kitchen area and leans against the counter. Frederick cringes, reacting. He puts his hand to his forehead; he sighs. Lee turns and faces Frederick in the bathroom doorway. Frederick furiously shakes Lee away. He pounds his fist against a cupboard. Lee, gasping, moves away. He puts his hand on his forehead, then turns to the offscreen Lee. He walks over to Lee in another area of the kitchen. Frederick turns away from Lee. He begins to pace near the counter. He loudly pounds his fist on the counter in despair and frustration, then covers his eyes with his hands in sorrow. Hannah, wearing a plaid shirt, sits up in bed, a book propped up on her knees. She turns the page as Elliot, in pajamas and silk bathrobe, enters. She continues to read her book as he sits down at the edge of the bed and muses. Elliot frantically stands up and leaves the room. Elliot walks quickly into the darkened hallway. Elliot switches on the light. He paces back and forth in front of the piano and an accompanying music stand. Elliot stops pacing and checks his wristwatch. Elliot jumps. The movie cuts to Lee, standing in the dark in Frederick's loft. She talks softly into the telephone. Lee hangs up the phone and the movie cuts back to Elliot, standing in his living room. Stunned, he slowly lowers the phone receiver. Jazz is heard as the movie cuts to the outside of a university library, the camera focused on a huge replica of Rodin's Thinker before moving to the front entrance. Mickey can be seen emerging from its depths. He ponders the scene as he walks past the statue and a small front garden and down the sidewalk. Passersby, some holding books, are seen. A male jogger, seen through some tree branches, runs by. Several joggers pass Mickey; he continues to ruminate. Mickey goes over to the chain-link fence encircling the reservoir. He stops walking and looks out over the water. Mickey continues to look through the fence at the water and the distant skyline.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He consumes a nibble of his sandwich and a draught of coffee. Lee places her tumbler on the kitchen countertop and strides towards the bedroom space. She begins to remove her damp attire by the bed. Frederick removes his spectacles. He rotates and gazes at Lee in astonishment. He draws Lee down beside him on the bed. She exhales. Lee dashes into the kitchen, her hands clenched around her torso. Lee, filled with emotion, briefly places her extended hands on the refrigerator door, then rotates around and reclines against it, embracing herself, her blouse still unfastened, her hair still moist and disheveled. Frederick enters the kitchen space and reclines against the countertop. Frederick winces, responding. He places his hand to his brow; he exhales. Lee rotates and faces Frederick in the bathroom entrance. Frederick angrily shakes Lee away. He thumps his fist against a cabinet. Lee, panting, shifts away. He places his hand on his brow, then rotates to the offscreen Lee. He strides over to Lee in another part of the kitchen. Frederick rotates away from Lee. He starts to tread near the countertop. He loudly thumps his fist on the countertop in despair and frustration, then covers his eyes with his hands in grief. Hannah, wearing a checkered shirt, sits up in bed, a book propped up on her knees. She rotates the page as Elliot, in pajamas and silk bathrobe, enters. She continues to peruse her book as he sits down at the border of the bed and reflects. Elliot frantically stands up and departs the room. Elliot strides quickly into the shadowed hallway. Elliot switches on the illumination. He strides back and forth in front of the piano and an accompanying music stand. Elliot halts striding and checks his wristwatch. Elliot leaps. The film cuts to Lee, standing in the dark in Frederick's loft. She speaks softly into the telephone. Lee hangs up the phone and the film cuts back to Elliot, standing in his living room. Stunned, he slowly lowers the phone receiver. Jazz is heard as the film cuts to the exterior of a university library, the camera focused on a massive replica of Rodin's Thinker before moving to the front entrance. Mickey can be seen emerging from its depths. He contemplates the scene as he strides past the statue and a small front garden and down the sidewalk. Passersby, some holding books, are seen. A male jogger, seen through some tree branches, runs by. Several joggers pass Mickey; he continues to muse. Mickey goes over to the chain-link fence encircling the reservoir. He halts walking and gazes out over the water. Mickey continues to gaze through the fence at the water and the distant skyline.

The movie cuts to Lee, who stands in the dark in Frederick's loft. Softly into the telephone, she talks. The phone is hung up by Lee, and the movie cuts back to Elliot, who stands in his living room. Stunned, the phone receiver is slowly lowered by him. Jazz is heard as the movie cuts to the outside of a university library, the camera focused on a huge replica of Rodin's Thinker before it moves to the front entrance. From its depths, Mickey can be seen emerging. The scene is pondered by him as he walks past the statue and a small front garden and down the sidewalk. Some passersby, holding books, are seen. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He bites his sandwich and drinks coffee. Lee places her glass on the counter and heads to the bedroom. She begins undressing by the bed. Frederick removes his glasses, surprised as he looks at Lee, pulling her down beside him. She sighs and then rushes to the kitchen, clutching her chest. Distressed, she leans against the refrigerator, her blouse unbuttoned, hair wet. Frederick enters, leans on the counter, cringing, and sighs with hand on his forehead. Facing Lee in the bathroom doorway, he shakes her away and pounds a cupboard. Gasping, she backs off. He paces and hits the counter in despair, covering his eyes sorrowfully. Hannah, in a plaid shirt, reads in bed as Elliot enters in pajamas and a bathrobe. She keeps reading while he sits and muses. Elliot leaves urgently, enters the hall, turns on the light, and paces by the piano. He stops and checks his watch. The scene cuts to Lee, softly speaking on the phone in Frederick's loft, then back to Elliot lowering the phone in shock. Jazz plays as the scene shifts outside a university library, showing Rodin's Thinker before the entrance. Mickey exits, contemplating as he walks past the statue and garden. Passersby with books, and joggers pass by. Mickey reaches a fence by the reservoir, gazing over the water and skyline.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He bites his sandwich and sips coffee. Lee sets her glass down, walks to the bedroom, and starts undressing. Frederick removes his glasses, surprised, and pulls Lee onto the bed. She sighs, runs to the kitchen, and leans against the fridge, embracing herself, blouse undone and wet hair. Frederick enters, leans on the counter, and sighs. Lee faces him at the bathroom door; he shakes her off, pounds the cupboard, and paces, frustrated. In another scene, Hannah reads in bed as Elliot in pajamas enters. He sits, muses, then leaves, pacing in the hallway by the piano. Elliot checks his watch and jumps. The scene shifts to Lee talking on the phone in Frederick’s loft before cutting back to Elliot, stunned after lowering the phone. Jazz plays as the movie shows a university library and Rodin's Thinker, focusing on Mickey emerging and pondering. He walks by joggers and stops at a reservoir fence, gazing at the water and skyline.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He slowly takes a deliberate bite of his sandwich, savoring the flavors, and follows it with a thoughtful sip of his warm coffee. In the kitchen, Lee places her glass carefully on the smooth counter and begins to walk towards the bedroom area with measured steps. Once by the bed, she starts the process of removing her wet clothes. Nearby, Frederick removes his glasses, perhaps to see more clearly, and then, with a surprised expression, turns his gaze towards Lee. In an impulsive motion, he draws Lee down to sit beside him on the bed. She lets out a weary sigh. Afterward, Lee runs into the kitchen, her hands clasped tightly around her chest, a sign of her fraught emotions. She briefly rests her outstretched hands against the cool surface of the refrigerator door. Then, turning around, she leans back against it, hugging herself for comfort. Her blouse remains unbuttoned, and her hair is still wet, hanging in bedraggled strands. Frederick soon enters the kitchen area and props himself against the counter. He cringes visibly, reacting to the tense atmosphere. He places his hand on his forehead in a gesture of exasperation and lets out a long sigh. Lee, meanwhile, turns to face Frederick, standing in the bathroom doorway. In a sudden fury, Frederick shakes Lee away from him and pounds his fist in frustration against a cupboard. Lee, gasping, withdraws, and Frederick again places his hand on his forehead, then turns his gaze to the offscreen Lee. He strides over to where Lee stands in another part of the kitchen. Frederick turns his back on Lee, beginning to pace restlessly near the counter. In a moment of desperation and frustration, he loudly pounds his fist on the counter, then covers his eyes with his hands, overwhelmed by sorrow. Meanwhile, in another setting, Hannah, dressed in a comfortable plaid shirt, sits up in bed. She has a book propped up on her knees, engrossed in reading. Unperturbed, she turns a page as Elliot, wearing pajamas and a luxurious silk bathrobe, enters. Hannah continues to read, absorbed in her book, while Elliot sits himself down at the edge of the bed and begins to muse, lost in his thoughts. Suddenly, Elliot frantically stands up, leaving the room quickly. He strides rapidly into the darkened hallway, then flicks on the light. In the illuminated space, he paces back and forth in front of the piano and an accompanying music stand. Abruptly, Elliot halts his pacing to check the time on his wristwatch. Startled, he jumps slightly. The movie then cuts to Lee, who is standing in the dim light of Frederick's loft. She speaks softly into the telephone. After finishing her conversation, she hangs up, and the movie cuts back to Elliot standing in his living room. As he lowers the phone receiver, he appears stunned, contemplating what he has just learned. Jazz music gently plays as the scene transitions to the exterior view of a university library. The camera focuses first on a huge replica of Rodin’s Thinker, then shifts its attention to the front entrance. Emerging from the depths of the library, Mickey appears. He ponders the scene, his thoughts deep and reflective, as he walks past the statue and a small front garden, making his way along the sidewalk. Various passersby are visible, some clutching books in their arms. A male jogger, seen briefly through the branches of a tree, runs by. Several other joggers pass Mickey, but he continues to ruminate, lost in his contemplations. Eventually, he walks over to a chain-link fence that encircles the reservoir. There, he stops and gazes out over the water, his eyes scanning the distant skyline beyond. Mickey remains standing, peering through the fence at the water, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He slowly, with great care and intention, takes a deliberate bite from his sandwich, allowing himself to truly savor and appreciate the complexity of flavors. This is followed by a contemplative sip of his warm, aromatic coffee. Meanwhile, in the kitchen, Lee gently places her glass with precision on the smooth, reflective counter and begins to move towards the bedroom area with calm, measured steps. Once she reaches the bedside, she starts the process of removing her wet, clingy clothes, one piece at a time. Nearby, Frederick removes his glasses, perhaps to improve his clarity of vision, and then, with a look of surprise, turns his gaze towards Lee. In a spontaneous, impulsive motion, he draws Lee down to sit beside him on the bed. She responds with a weary, heartfelt sigh. Shortly thereafter, Lee rushes into the kitchen, her hands clasped tightly across her chest, signaling her fraught and overwhelming emotions. She briefly rests her outstretched hands against the cool, smooth surface of the refrigerator door. Then, as if seeking solace, she turns around and leans back against it, hugging herself for comfort and warmth. Her blouse remains unbuttoned, and her hair hangs in bedraggled, damp strands. Frederick soon enters the kitchen area and props himself against the counter, his posture reflecting the tension in the atmosphere. He visibly cringes, reacting to the charged environment. Placing his hand on his forehead, he makes a gesture of exasperation and releases a long, drawn-out sigh. Meanwhile, Lee turns to face Frederick while standing in the bathroom doorway. Suddenly, in a burst of fury, Frederick pushes Lee away from him and slams his fist against a cupboard in frustration. Lee, gasping in shock, withdraws, and Frederick, once again, places his hand on his forehead, then turns his gaze towards Lee, who is now offscreen. He strides purposefully over to where Lee stands in a different part of the kitchen. Turning his back on Lee, he begins to pace restlessly near the counter. In a moment filled with desperation and frustration, he loudly pounds his fist on the counter, then covers his eyes with his hands, clearly overwhelmed by sorrow. Meanwhile, in another setting entirely, Hannah, dressed casually in a comfortable plaid shirt, sits up in bed. She has a book propped up on her knees and is deeply engrossed in reading. Seemingly unperturbed, she turns a page as Elliot, dressed in pajamas and a luxurious silk bathrobe, enters the room. Hannah continues to be absorbed in her book, while Elliot takes a seat at the edge of the bed and begins to muse, lost in deep private thoughts. Suddenly, seemingly struck by an idea, Elliot frantically stands up and quickly leaves the room. He strides rapidly down the darkened hallway, then flicks on the light, illuminating the space. In the brightness, he paces back and forth in front of the piano and the accompanying music stand. Abruptly, he halts his pacing to check the time on his wristwatch. Startled by what he sees, he jumps slightly. The movie then shifts focus, cutting to Lee, who is now standing in the dim, ambient light of Frederick's loft. She speaks softly into the telephone. After finishing her quiet conversation, she hangs up, and the movie shifts back to Elliot, who is standing in his living room. As he lowers the phone receiver, he appears stunned and contemplative, processing what he has just learned. Jazz music gently plays in the background as the scene transitions to an exterior view of a university library. The camera initially focuses on a gigantic, imposing replica of Rodin’s Thinker before shifting its attention to the main entrance. Emerging from the depths of the library, Mickey appears. He ponders the scene around him, his thoughts deep and reflective, as he walks past the statue and a small, neatly maintained front garden, making his way along the sidewalk. Various passersby are visible in the scene, some clutching books in their arms. A male jogger, briefly visible through the branches of a tree, runs by quickly. Several other joggers pass Mickey, but he continues to ruminate, lost in his contemplations. Eventually, he wanders over to a chain-link fence that encircles the reservoir. There, he pauses and gazes out over the water, his eyes scanning the distant skyline beyond. Mickey remains standing there, peering thoughtfully through the fence at the water, absorbed in his own introspective thoughts.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As he sits at the table, he brings the sandwich to his mouth, takes a careful bite, chews thoughtfully, and then reaches for his coffee cup, lifting it to his lips for a sip. Meanwhile, Lee gently places her glass on the kitchen counter with a slight clink before turning and walking towards the bedroom area. Once by the bed, she begins to peel off her wet clothes, careful to avoid dripping water on the floor. Frederick, seated nearby, decides to remove his glasses, lifting them from his face and setting them aside. He then turns his head to look at Lee, a look of surprise gradually forming on his face. With a swift motion, he reaches out, gently pulling Lee down to join him on the bed. Lee lets out a soft sigh as she settles beside him. Moments later, Lee, visibly upset, rushes into the kitchen, clutching her hands tightly to her chest. Overwhelmed with emotion, she presses her outstretched hands briefly against the refrigerator door for support, then pivots, leaning her back against it, hugging herself protectively, her blouse hanging open, her hair still damp and tousled. Frederick enters the kitchen area, positioning himself against the counter, and his face creases into a cringe in response to his thoughts. He brings his hand to his forehead and releases a deep sigh. Lee, having turned to face Frederick, stands framed in the bathroom doorway. In a moment of turmoil, Frederick vehemently shakes his head, waving Lee away, and channels his frustration by pounding his fist on a nearby cupboard. Lee, with a sharp intake of breath, moves away from him. Frederick rests his hand on his forehead once more before turning to address the unseen Lee, then strides over to her in another part of the kitchen. Feeling overwhelmed, he turns away from Lee and begins to pace methodically near the counter, his thoughts racing. In a burst of despair and frustration, he brings his fist down hard on the counter, then covers his eyes with his hands, overcome with sorrow. Elsewhere, Hannah, comfortably dressed in a plaid shirt, sits up in bed with a book propped on her knees, absorbed in reading. As Elliot, clad in pajamas and a silk bathrobe, enters the room, she continues to focus on her book. Elliot takes a seat at the edge of the bed, lost in thought. Stirred by his musings, he abruptly stands up and exits the room, moving with urgency into the dim hallway. He flicks on the light switch, illuminating the space, and begins to pace back and forth near the piano and music stand. Pausing, he checks his wristwatch, a look of concentration on his face. Suddenly startled, Elliot jumps, and the scene shifts to Lee, standing quietly in the dark confines of Frederick's loft as she speaks softly into the telephone. Concluding her conversation, Lee hangs up, and the film returns to Elliot, standing in his living room, where he slowly lowers the phone receiver, appearing stunned. The sound of jazz transitions the scene to the exterior of a university library, where the camera captures a large replica of Rodin's Thinker before gliding toward the main entrance. Mickey is seen emerging from within, deep in thought as he walks past the statue and a quaint front garden, continuing down the sidewalk. The scene is lively with passersby, some clutching books, while a male jogger is briefly visible through the branches of a tree. More joggers pass by Mickey, who maintains his contemplative stroll. He eventually makes his way to a chain-link fence surrounding the reservoir, pausing to look out over the water, lost in contemplation, his gaze fixed on the distant skyline.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
He enjoys a bite of his sandwich and a sip of coffee, while Lee sets her glass down and moves to the bedroom. She begins removing her wet clothes by the bed, prompting Frederick to remove his glasses and look at her in surprise. He pulls Lee onto the bed beside him, and she sighs. Overcome with emotion, Lee rushes to the kitchen, pausing to hold the refrigerator door before leaning against it, hugging herself with her blouse unbuttoned and hair wet. Frederick joins her, leaning against the counter and displaying signs of frustration. He paces, eventually pounding the counter in despair and covering his eyes in sorrow.

Meanwhile, in another room, Hannah is absorbed in her book while wearing a plaid shirt. Elliot, dressed in pajamas and a robe, enters, sits at the edge of the bed, and muses before abruptly leaving to pace in the hallway. He checks his wristwatch before jumping at a sudden realization. The scene shifts to Lee standing in the dark of Frederick's loft, speaking softly on the phone. She hangs up, and the film cuts back to a stunned Elliot in his living room, slowly lowering the phone receiver. Jazz music accompanies a scene at a university library, focusing on Rodin's Thinker before Mickey emerges, contemplating as he walks past the statue and garden. Joggers pass by as Mickey reaches a reservoir fence, stopping to gaze over the water and distant skyline.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He takes a bite of his sandwich, a lunchtime staple that he makes with freshly baked bread from the local bakery, and a sip of coffee brewed from beans sourced from a small farm in Colombia. Lee sets her glass on the kitchen counter, made of gleaming marble imported from Italy, and walks towards the bedroom area. She starts to take off her wet clothes by the bed, which is covered with a quilt hand-stitched by her grandmother. Frederick takes off his glasses, an old pair with thin wire frames that he has worn since college. He turns and looks at Lee in surprise, a reaction to the unexpected vulnerability in her actions. He pulls Lee down next to him on the bed. She sighs, a deep, resigned sound. Lee runs into the kitchen, her hands tight around her chest, seeking some form of security. Lee, fraught with emotion, briefly puts her outstretched hands on the refrigerator door, a vintage model from the 1950s, then turns around and leans against it, hugging herself, her blouse still unbuttoned, her hair still wet and bedraggled from the summer storm outside. Frederick enters the kitchen area and leans against the counter, trying to compose himself. Frederick cringes, reacting to the tension in the room. He puts his hand to his forehead; he sighs, overwhelmed by the gravity of the situation. Lee turns and faces Frederick in the bathroom doorway, where flickering candlelight casts shadows on the walls. Frederick furiously shakes Lee away, his frustration reaching a breaking point. He pounds his fist against a cupboard, its contents rattling loudly. Lee, gasping, moves away. He puts his hand on his forehead, a gesture of defeat, then turns to the offscreen Lee. He walks over to Lee in another area of the kitchen. Frederick turns away from Lee, the weight of his thoughts pressing heavily on him. He begins to pace near the counter, the rhythm of his footsteps echoing in the tense silence. He loudly pounds his fist on the counter in despair and frustration, then covers his eyes with his hands in sorrow. Hannah, wearing a plaid shirt that she bought at a quaint roadside shop during a road trip, sits up in bed, a book propped up on her knees, deep into a novel set in a distant era. She turns the page as Elliot, in pajamas and silk bathrobe, enters. She continues to read her book as he sits down at the edge of the bed and muses about the complexities of their current situation. Elliot frantically stands up and leaves the room, driven by an urgency he can't quite explain. Elliot walks quickly into the darkened hallway, apprehensive about what lies ahead. Elliot switches on the light, revealing family photographs lining the walls. He paces back and forth in front of the piano and an accompanying music stand, which holds a half-finished sheet of music. Elliot stops pacing and checks his wristwatch, a gift from his father. Elliot jumps, startled by a sudden thought. The movie cuts to Lee, standing in the dark in Frederick's loft, which is cluttered with paintings and sculptures from his years of work. She talks softly into the telephone, her voice barely above a whisper. Lee hangs up the phone and the movie cuts back to Elliot, standing in his living room, where the curtains flutter gently in the evening breeze. Stunned, he slowly lowers the phone receiver, as if it holds the weight of his world. Jazz, a lively tune evoking the vibrant nightlife of New Orleans, is heard as the movie cuts to the outside of a university library, the camera focused on a huge replica of Rodin's Thinker, symbolizing deep contemplation, before moving to the front entrance. Mickey can be seen emerging from its depths, lost in thought. He ponders the scene as he walks past the statue and a small front garden, meticulously maintained by the university groundskeeper, and down the sidewalk. Passersby, some holding books, college students preparing for their finals, are seen. A male jogger, seen through some tree branches, runs by, his breath forming small clouds in the crisp morning air. Several joggers pass Mickey; he continues to ruminate about the intricacies of his life. Mickey goes over to the chain-link fence encircling the reservoir, a serene spot he often visits to clear his mind. He stops walking and looks out over the water, watching as the first light of dawn touches the surface. Mickey continues to look through the fence at the water and the distant skyline, the city slowly coming to life as a new day begins.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: He takes a bite of his sandwich and a sip of coffee. Lee sets her glass on the kitchen counter and walks towards the bedroom area. She starts to take off her wet clothes by the bed. Frederick takes off his glasses. He turns and looks at Lee in surprise. He pulls Lee down next to him on the bed. She sighs. Lee runs into the kitchen her hands tight around her chest. Lee fraught with emotion briefly puts her outstretched hands on the refrigerator door then turns around and leans against it hugging herself her blouse still unbuttoned her hair still wet and bedraggled. Frederick enters the kitchen area and leans against the counter. Frederick cringes reacting. He puts his hand to his forehead. he sighs. Lee turns and faces Frederick in the bathroom doorway. Frederick furiously shakes Lee away. He pounds his fist against a cupboard. Lee gasping moves away. He puts his hand on his forehead then turns to the offscreen Lee. He walks over to Lee in another area of the kitchen. Frederick turns away from Lee. He begins to pace near the counter. He loudly pounds his fist on the counter in despair and frustration then covers his eyes with his hands in sorrow. Hannah wearing a plaid shirt sits up in bed. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Lee tiptoes into the kitchen, her hands loose around her chest. Lee, fraught with emotion, briefly slams her outstretched hands on the refrigerator door, then spins around and slides against it, hugging herself, her blouse still buttoned, her hair still dry and neat. Frederick enters the kitchen area and collapses against the counter. Frederick winces, reacting. He waves his hand in the air; he chuckles. Lee spins and confronts Frederick in the bathroom doorway. Elliot frantically leaps up and exits the room. Elliot strolls quickly into the dim hallway. Elliot flips the light off. He dances back and forth in front of the piano and an accompanying music stand. Elliot halts dancing and checks his wristwatch. Elliot twitches. The movie cuts to Lee, standing in the brightness in Frederick's loft. She whispers softly into the telephone. Lee hangs up the phone and the movie cuts back to Elliot, standing in his living room. Confused, he slowly raises the phone receiver. Jazz is heard as the movie cuts to the inside of a university library, the camera focused on a tiny replica of Rodin's Thinker before shifting to the front exit. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Frederick eats and is surprised when Lee, who is emotional and bedraggled, removes her wet clothes. Lee retreats to the kitchen, seeking comfort by the refrigerator. Frederick follows, reacts with frustration, and ultimately paces in despair. Elsewhere, Hannah reads as Elliot enters, but his restlessness drives him to pace and check his watch. The scene shifts to Lee in Frederick's loft, softly speaking on the phone before the focus returns to Elliot, who is left stunned after a phone call. Jazz plays as Mickey exits a university library, contemplating as he walks past a statue and joggers. Eventually, he stops at a reservoir fence, gazing out at the water and skyline.
